title: 36 Lanes to Nowhere: Inside China’s Massive Holiday Traffic Jam
description: A drone pans across the Wuzhuang Toll Station in Anhui and all you see is red—thousands of taillights spread across 36 lanes that compress into four. Holiday drivers are pouring out of China’s National Day/Mid-Autumn “Golden Week” and into a forced merge that defeats momentum. Local reports pegged ...
titleSummary: "China's Nightmare Gridlock: The 36-Lane Roadblock That Refused to Clear"
descriptionSummary: At the Wuzhuang Toll Station in Anhui, a sea of red taillights stretches across 36 lanes as they converge into four, slowing the flow of holiday traffic from China's National Day celebrations.

title: The Largest Hidden Barn Find in Alabama Is Finally For Sale
description: This is probably the most significant classic car discovery in recent memory. Nestled across multiple buildings in Alabama, owner Greg Rusk has amassed such an enormous classic car collection that he's lost count of both the vehicles and the structures housing them. descriptionSummary: In a staggering find, Alabama collector Greg Rusk has amassed a colossal classic car hoard spanning numerous properties, with the exact number of cars and buildings now impossible to tally due to sheer scale.

title: Nissan’s Hybrid Ambitions Could Lead to Ford, Stellantis Partnerships

descriptionSummary: Ford has trimmed costs from its 2026 F-150 Lightning, maintaining essential features across the range. Additionally, the automaker is offering lease discounts on select EV models until year's end, following the elimination of federal electric vehicle incentives in September.

title: New Edmunds Data Sounds Alarm on New Car Affordability
description: According to new data on new-car financing trends from the car-buying authorities at Edmunds, customers are bringing the least amount of cash to dealerships to secure a down payment for the first time since 2021, as the average new-vehicle down payment has reached its lowest level since Q4 2021. ...

descriptionSummary: A report by Edmunds highlights a shift in new-car financing habits: buyers are now contributing less cash towards down payments than at any point since early 2021, with current averages reaching historic lows.

title: Rivian Sales Were Way Up in Q3. But What Happens Next?
description: With the $7,500 federal EV rebate ending, a small jump in electrified sales last month shouldn’t surprise anyone. descriptionSummary: As the federal electric vehicle rebate expires, it's no coincidence that sales of eco-friendly cars have shown a slight uptick. Ford logged its strongest quarter ever for electrified vehicles, shifting over 86,000 units.

title: One Senator Just Got GM to End Its EV Tax Credit Program

title: China’s EV Boom Has a Dark Side: Thousands of Dealerships Are Shutting Down
description: China’s auto dealers are facing their toughest moment in decades as the rapid shift to electric vehicles, overcapacity, and intense price wars squeeze profits to the brink. Once a vital link between automakers and consumers, the country’s 4S dealerships (sales, service, spare parts, and surveys) ...

descriptionSummary: China's auto dealers are navigating a perfect storm of challenges, as the electric vehicle revolution, oversaturated markets, and brutal price competition threaten to decimate their profits. The country's 4S shops, once the linchpin of car sales, now face an uncertain future.

title: Kia’s New Battery Tech Could Save EV Owners Thousands in Repairs
description: Battery-monitoring system checks individual cells for problemsKia says this allows for more targeted repairs, saving customers moneyEuropean Union will require battery-health monitoring starting in 2027 Most of the value of an electric vehicle is tied up in its battery pack, so ensuring that pack ...

descriptionSummary: A cutting-edge battery health check system identifies and addresses individual cell issues before they cause damage, enabling efficient and cost-effective repairs. This technology is set to become mandatory in European Union vehicles by 2027.

title: Jaguar Land Rover Bounces Back from Month-Long Shutdown

descriptionSummary: Jaguar Land Rover's production has slowly resumed after a devastating cyberattack forced a temporary shutdown of its Wolverhampton and Solihull factories, while the company grapples with estimated damages exceeding $2.67 billion.

descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz experienced a significant decline in global sales during the third quarter, with deliveries plummeting 12 percent year-over-year to 525,300 vehicles. Weakness in key markets like China and the US drove the downturn, impacting passenger car and van sales.

As a result, the company expects reduced pre-tax earnings and a lower return on investment for its core automotive business.

description: Toyota is exploring a new way to enhance off-road capability, by sending a drone ahead of the vehicle.
